Information Arts “Chinese Coded Character Set”
1 This document specifies the Chinese graphic characters and the hexadecimal representation of the binary codes used in information technology.
This document applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other text graphic characters information.

This document applies to the technical products that have the function of processing and exchanging information with Chinese and other character graphics characters, including but not limited to software products such as input method, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text conversion, and Chinese writing, and convenience products such as computers, communication terminal equipment, electronic book readers, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents
The contents of the following documents are incorporated by reference as necessary to this document.

For the references with date, only the corresponding version is applicable to this document; for the references without date, the latest edition (including all amendments) is applicable to this document.
GB/T 2312 1-1980 “Information Exchange Chinese Character Coded Character Set” Basic Set
GB/I 11383-1989 Information Processing "Eight-bit Coded Character Set with Control and Format Character"
GB/T 13000 Information technology - Universal multiple-byte coded character set (UCS)

4 Vocabulary
4.1 Introduction
The characters in this document are encoded in single, double, or quadruple bytes.
The single byte part collects all 128 characters from GB/T 11383-1989 0x00~0x7F.
4.3 Double-byte segment part
The double-byte portion includes all the graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, the CJK unified Han characters in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
The characters in the double-byte segment part are defined in Appendix A.
The graphic, code position and function of the symbolic text description should conform to the requirements of Appendix B.
Note: GB/T 13000 is the unified encoding for Chinese, Japanese, Korean, and Vietnamese characters.
Chinese characters with unique abstract shapes are assigned a unique code position; Chinese characters with different sources but the same abstract shapes are assigned a shared code position.
The encoded Chinese characters are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK represents China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Four-character Segment

The four-character segment includes the 66 CJK Unified Han characters (9FA6 to 9FEF) in GB/T 13000, excluding the 8 characters from 9FB4 to 9FBB), CJK Unified Han characters extension A, CJK Unified Han characters extension BCJK Unified Han characters extension C, CJK Unified Han characters extension DCJK Unified Han characters extension,
The characters in the four-component part are defined in Appendix C.
5 Overall Structure of the System
In the main text, all numbers preceded by 0x are in hexadecimal, and those without 0x are in decimal.
The representations in the appendix are all in hexadecimal, and the other numbers are in decimal.
The single segment part adopts the coding structure of GB/T 11383-1989, using the code positions 0x00~0x7F.
The double byte portion uses two eight bit binary strings to represent a character, with the first byte ranging from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the second byte ranging from 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.

The four-byte section uses 0x30 to 0x39, which are not used in GB/T 11383-1989, as the suffix for the extension of the encoding of the double byte section, and the encoding range is 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The first character of the four-character word is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second character is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; and the fourth character is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39. That is, 0x81308

9.1 General
Three levels of implementation are specified in this document.

The system software products that meet the corresponding implementation level should provide the input and output functions of all characters within the range of the corresponding implementation level.
9.2 Implementation Level 1

Implementation Level 1 supports the CJK Unified Han Character (i.e., 0x82358F33 to 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Han Character Expansion A (i.e., 0x8139EE39 to 0x82358738) in the segment encoding part, bi-season encoding part, and four-character subscript
Any product covered by this document shall meet the requirements of Implementation Level 1.
Note: Depending on the software application needs, the Implementation Level 1 can also select any one or more of the non-Chinese character types listed in Table 3.
9.3 Implementation Level 2
Level 2 includes Level 1.
In addition, the Realization Level 2 also supports the encoding Chinese characters that are not included in the General Standard Chinese Characters Table.
The code positions and shapes of the Chinese characters collected in the Table of General Standard Chinese Characters) are shown in the appendix.
The system software and the support software shall satisfy the requirements of the implementation level 2.

Note: The system software and supporting software includes, but is not limited to, the operating system, the database management system, and the middleware (for information on the classification of software products, see GB/T 36475).
9.4 Implementation level 3
Level 3 includes Level 2.
In addition, the level of realization 3 also supports all the Chinese characters specified in this document and the radicals in Table 3.
Products for use in government and public services shall meet the requirements of Level 3.

Note: The government and public service industry includes, but is not limited to, railway transportation industry, road transportation industry, water transportation industry, air transportation industry, intermodal transportation and transportation agency, postal service, logistics, health, state institutions, social security (for information on industry classification, see GB/T 4754).

The contents of this page are taken from the complete documentation of the GNU C compiler, and are limited to explaining the meaning of the options.
The EURo file and the Info file are authoritative files unless someone volunteers to maintain them.
Check the Info file for discrepancies between the manual page and the software.

If we find that the contents of this page cause obvious confusion and complaints because they are outdated, we will stop publishing it. There is no other choice, to update the Info file at the same time as the man page, because the other work of maintaining Gnu cc does not leave us time to do this. The GNU project thinks that the man page is an outdated product and should be used elsewhere.

For complete and up to date documentation, see the Info file `gee' or the Using and Porting GNU CC (for version 2.0) (ft&/HAIZE#H GNU CC 2.0) manual. Both are derived from the Texinfo file gee.texinfo.
The C and C++ compilers are integrated. They both require one or more of the four steps to process the input files: preprocessing, Hii, (assembly) MERE, (linking).
The source file extension identifies the language of the source file, but for the compiler, the extension controls the default settings:
gcc treats the preprocessed file (.i) as a C file and sets up a C-like linkage,
g++ treats the preprocessed file (.i) as a C++ file and sets up a C++ linkage.
The suffix of the source file indicates the type of language and the operation to be performed:
.c C source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.C C++ source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.cc C++ source program; preprocess, compile, assemble
.CXX C++ source program; preprocess, compile, link
.m Objective-C source program; preprocess, compile, link
.i  preprocessed c file; compile, assemble
.ii  preprocessed c++ file; compile, assemble
.s Assembly Language Source Program; Assemble
Compiled language source program; preprocessing, compilation
.h preprocessor files; usually do not appear on the command line. Other files with suffixes are passed to the linker. Usually include:
.0 Object file
.a  Archive file
Unless the -cec, -s, or -E option is used (or the compilation error stops the entire process), linking is always the last step.

All .e files, -1 libraries, and unrecognized filenames (including specified .o H symbolic files and .a libraries) corresponding to the source program are passed to the linker options (OPTIONS) in the order specified on the command line during the linking phase.
The options must be separated by : de ' and not `-d -r '.
Most `=-E:' and `-W' options have two opposite formats: -fname and -fno-name (or -Wname and -Wno-name).
Formats not being default options are listed here.

It is the same as the `-Ethis-is-variable' option.

In particular, the preprocessor-related content mentioned above, but not the other effects of the `-traditional' option.
-fdollars-in-identifiers allows the `$' character in identifiers (C++ only) .
You can specify the "--no-dollars-in-identifiers" option to disable the use of the `$' character.
(GNU C++ allows the `$' character by default on some target systems, but not all.)
-fenum-int-equiv allows implicit conversions from ant types to enumeration types (MEF++).
Normally, GNU C++ allows a conversion from enum to int, but not the other way around.
-fexternal-—templates generates smaller code for template declarations (template declarations) (limited to c++), by generating a copy of each template function only where it is defined.
To use this option successfully, you must mark #pragma implementation (define) or #pragma interface (declare) in all files that use templates.
When the program is compiled with `-fexternal-templates ', all template instantiations are external types. You must have the instantiations you need appear in the implementation files.
This can be achieved with the use of typedef, which references each instance as required.
Correspondingly, if the default option `-fno-external-templates' is used at compile time, all template instances are explicitly set to internal.
All member functions (except constructors and the mnew or delete member operators) are considered virtual for their class.
This does not imply that every call to a member function will go through the internal virtual function table.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly; in such cases, it is called directly.
-fcond-mismatch allows the types of the second and third parameters of the conditional expression to mismatch.
The value of such an expression is Void.-fthis-—is-variable, which allows this to be assigned (C++ only).
The combination of user defined free storage management into c++ makes the assignable `this' inappropriate.
Therefore, by default, the internal assignment of this to this in a class member function is a no-op.
However, for the sake of backward compatibility, you can make this operation effective by the `-fthis-is-variable' option.
-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Various machines have their own default char type, which may be either unsigned char or signed char.
Ideally, when the data is dependent on its sign, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.
However, many programs are already written to use only simple chars, and this is a signed number (or unsigned, depending on the target machine).
This option, and its negation, cause such programs to work with the corresponding default values.
The type char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it behaves exactly like one of them.
If no `signed' or 'unsigned' qualifier is explicitly declared, these options define a signed or unsigned bit field.
By default, the bit fields are signed because they inherit the basic integer types, such as int, which are signed, but if the `-traditional' option is specified, the bit fields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data segments and does not treat them specially.
This is to maintain compatibility with some old programs, which consider the conversion of string constants to be a very bad idea, and the `-traditional' option has the same effect.
Exec Summary
COVID-19 Impact on Drug Markets
Its impact could be similar to the economic crisis in 2008.
the global COVID19 pandemic has plunged the world into unprecedented crisis.
In many countries, the disease has already overwhelmed and nearly collapsed health services, and the restrictions imposed by governments have caused severe disruptions in the global economy.
the impact of the pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be profound.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to manufacture drugs, as restrictions on movement also limit access to precursors and essential chemicals.
Traffickers may be unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions and may have to find new routes and methods.
Patterns of drug use and supply may change, and government responses may be hampered.
The changes brought about by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but some lessons can be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug users began to seek out cheaper synthetic substances and shifted to injecting drugs.
At the same time, governments have been cutting drug-related budgets.
Prevention interventions and drug treatment services could be hit hard if governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way.
In addition, the priority of interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to operate.
Some countries have a significant amount of narcotics smuggled through commercial flights, and these countries are expected to be the most directly affected by drug trafficking activities.

Messengers will carry methamphetamine and other synthetic drugs in their hand luggage or in their personal baggage, sometimes in large quantities. With restrictions on air travel almost everywhere, the use of commercial air travel to supply drugs may be completely disrupted.
Although the international postal supply chain has also been disrupted, activities involving the use of the dark web and parcel post for trafficking may increase.
In the long term, economic recession and related lockdown measures could disrupt the drug market.

The rising unemployment rate and lack of opportunities will make poor and vulnerable people more likely to use drugs in a harmful way, develop drug-related illnesses and turn to drug-related criminal activities, whether as producers or traffickers.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of the situation to offer services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members.
These shifts could quickly take root as governments' capacity to respond is reduced, becoming the new reality for many communities.
Expansion and complexity
Market growth
the population growth pattern partly explains the expansion of the market.
Drug use has been increasing worldwide, both in absolute numbers and as a proportion of the world population.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 21 million drug users, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64, and in 2018, it was estimated that there were 269 million drug users, accounting for 5.3% of this population.
The growth rate of drug use in developing countries has been much faster than that in developed countries over the past two decades.

This reflects to some extent the difference in overall population growth during this period, 7% in developed countries and 28% in developing countries, but also the faster growth of the young population in developing countries.
Adolescents and young adults account for the largest proportion of drug users.
During the period of 2000-2018, the population of this age group in developing countries increased by 16%, while the population of this age group in developed countries decreased by 10%.
1Urbanization is a driving factor of the current and future drug markets.
In both developed and developing countries, urban areas have higher drug use prevalence than rural areas.

The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the large-scale migration of the population from rural to urban areas. Currently, more than half of the world's population lives in urban areas, compared to 34% in 1960.
Urbanization is likely to be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, particularly in developing countries where urbanization is more pronounced.
Increased wealth is associated with increased drug use, but the poorest people bear the greatest burden of disease, and drug use is more common in developed countries than in developing countries.
Cocaine and other drugs are also more strongly associated with the world 's wealthier regions.
Similarly, within countries, the prevalence of drug abuse is higher among the socially affluent.
However, the rate of transition to drug dependence is higher among those with lower socioeconomic status.
data from a few countries suggest that the association between harmful patterns of drug use and disease is concentrated among the poor.
These patterns are less common in wealthier societies.
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labour market, such as rising unemployment, have been linked to increased drug use in the past, and the pandemic has already forced hundreds of millions of people into unemployment.

The pandemic could lead to further expansion of drug markets. The COVID-19 pandemic could lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illicit crop cultivation, either because of reduced state control or because of the economic crisis, which may lead more people to resort to illicit activities.

The restrictions associated with COVID-19 have led to a reduction in air and land transport, and sea smuggling may have increased as a result, with the risks of interception being lower and the volume of sea smuggling being greater than that of air or land smuggling.
Recently, there have been reports of cocaine shipments being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
Complexity Enhanced
The availability of non-internationally controlled substances is stable, but there is an increase in the number of new types of opioids with potential for harm.
Hundreds of synthetic drugs, many of them not under international control, have been added to the mix, along with plant-based substances such as cannabis, cocaine and heroin.
There are around 500 new psychoactive substances on the domestic market in member states every year.
Currently, the majority of these are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoids and small amounts of synthetic opioids.
While the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportion of those substances has changed.

In the total number of new psychoactive substances identified in 2014, the new psychoactive substances of the opioid type accounted for only 2 per cent, but this figure had risen to 9 per cent by 2018.

Many of the new psychoactive substances in the opioid class are fentanyl analogues, whose effects and dangers have been proven, leading to overdose deaths in North America and elsewhere, but to a lesser extent.
In North America, fentanyl is used as a cutting agent for heroin and other drugs, including cocaine and methamphetamine, and is also used to make counterfeit prescription opioids.

There is some evidence of injection of new psychoactive substances stimulants in Europe as well: a study of residues in discarded syringes in six European cities found that many syringes contained new psychoactive substances that produced stimulant effects.
2 the use of new psychoactive substances may be firmly established among vulnerable groups.
Single types of new psychoactive substances have almost never formed a large market.
evidence from Europe, however, suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among marginalized groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
22 countries reported prison use of new psychoactive substances, with synthetic cannabinoids identified as the main challenge in most of them.

Controls on precursor chemicals have forced innovation among drug manufacturers, and many chemicals used as precursors to synthesize amphetamine, methamphetamine, and "ecstasy" have been placed under international control.

Traffickers and manufacturers have been seeking alternatives, not only to materials that are less tightly controlled, but also to chemicals that are specifically designed to evade controls, known as "tailor-made precursors."
Restrictive measures aimed at stopping the spread of COVID-19 are likely to put further pressure on drug makers who rely on precursor chemicals.

Evidence from Mexico suggests this has already become a reality: in March 2020, a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from East Asia reportedly drove up prices of methamphetamine in Mexico and the United States.
the market is changing rapidly.
Synthetic drugs replace opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
The opiate market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have undergone changes between 2008 and 2018.
the number of opioids seized by the Russian authorities fell by about 80 % , and the number of people treated for opioid use disorders decreased substantially.
However, the market for stimulants appears to be growing.
Evidence suggests that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and a -pyrrolidinovalerophenone, are now readily available on the Russian drug market.
Russian authorities reported a sharp rise in the number of clandestine laboratories producing various illicit drugs, which more than doubled in two years, to 152 laboratories in 2018.
Afghanistan and Iraq methamphetamine markets grow
The importance of methamphetamine in Iraq was already revealed in 2012 by surveys of hospital, prison and other institutional staff.
Crystal methamphetamine has become a worrying main drug alongside "fenethylline" and tramadol.
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with drug users saying that cannabis was harder to obtain than "Captagon" or methamphetamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine laboratories, and the International Narcotics Control Board has expressed concern about large imports of pseudoephedrine preparations, which are used as precursors by methamphetamine laboratories.
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine manufacture appears to have begun in 2014.
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily increasing.
But seizures in the first half of 2019 amounted to 657 kg - a sharp increase compared to the previous year.
Large quantities of methamphetamine believed to originate in Afghanistan have also been seized in other countries, indicating a rapid rise in production.
Policy changes and trends
Most jurisdictions that have legalized cannabis for nonmedical use have seen an increase in its use.
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay and the US allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
In most of these jurisdictions, cannabis use has increased since legalization, although the same trend has been observed in other jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical cannabis use.

In the two states that first passed legislation in the US, Colorado and Washington, adult use of marijuana has increased, particularly in the past month and on a daily or near daily basis, and has exceeded the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that cannabis use has increased in Uruguay since 2011 , with almost a doubling of use in the past month .
This suggests that the increase is largely driven by frequent and regular use of marijuana.
Short-term data from Canada also indicate that increases in use have been accompanied by an expansion of the legal market from 2018 to 2019.
However, in 2019, 40 percent of cannabis users still obtained some products from illicit sources.
Is the reason for the global drop in seizures of cannabis herb legalization?
In 2018, global seizures of cannabis herb fell to their lowest level in 20 years, driven by a decline in North America, which has seen a 84% drop in the past decade.

In contrast, seizures in the rest of the world almost doubled over the same period. The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at liberalizing the cannabis market played a key role in the decline.
The regulation of new psychoactive substances seems to have a deterrent effect, but the effect of domestic regulation of new psychoactive substances is still difficult to assess.
Countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances show different prevalence of use of these substances.
In other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances decreased after domestic legislation.
Vulnerable populations face harms from both the licit and illicit drug markets. Pharmaceutical opioids for pain management and palliative care are mainly available in high @-@ income countries.
In 2018, more than 90% of all medically consumable opioids were in high-income countries.
approximately 50 % in North America , 40 % in Europe , and 2 % in Oceania .
these countries account for approximately 12 % of the global population .
The population of low- and middle-income countries is estimated to account for 88% of the global population, but less than 10% of the consumption of pharmaceutical opioids.
Obstacles to access to pharmaceutical opioids are related to many factors, including legislation , culture , health systems , and prescribing practices .
Poorer people are at greater risk of developing drug-related illnesses. About 35.6 million people had drug-related illnesses in 2018.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization can increase the risk of and exacerbate the consequences of drug use. This has been confirmed by research in high-income countries, where the social and economic trajectory of individuals is not only their status at a given point in time but also related to the risk of drug use.

Drug use also deepens socioeconomic disadvantage, further increasing the risk of unemployment, poverty, and homelessness, thereby perpetuating the cycle of disadvantage. These outcomes may also be linked to stigmatizing attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, ethnic minorities and migrants, sexual and gender diverse groups, those displaced by conflict or disaster, and those living in rural settings may also be disproportionately affected by the disease or face problems accessing treatment.

According to the disability adjusted life years ( DALY ) indicator , which estimates the number of healthy life years lost due to disability and premature death , the harmful effects of drug use have increased over the past decade.
Global disability adjusted life years due to drug use increased by 17 % between 2007 and 2018 .

the associated disability @-@ adjusted life years ( DALYs ) attributable to hepatocellular carcinoma ( HCC ) among injecting drug users with untreated chronic hepatitis C were particularly high at 40 %.
the relationship between drugs and violence is complex , and it is difficult to determine all the causal links between the use of psychoactive substances and violence .
Limited data from around the world suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide.
However , in violent events , alcohol seems to play a larger role than drugs .

While drug use may lead to crime, in some cases this link can be partly attributed to multiple mediators, such as socioeconomic disadvantage, and other types of adversity caused by individual risk factors, family environment, and peers.
The link between drug dealing and violence is multifaceted.
where there is a stable criminal structure , large scale organized criminal activity , including international drug trafficking , can be carried out without violence .

In the short term, the existence and extent of violence is more dependent on changes that destabilize the balance of power between organized criminal groups, such as changes in the size of the illicit market, the death or imprisonment of well-known criminals, and law enforcement measures that weaken one group relative to another.
the latest trends
Cannabis is the most commonly used substance, with opioids causing the most harm
an estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
By comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
But the related harms of opioids are often overlooked because they are less common.

Of the estimated 167,000 drug use disorder deaths in 2017, 66 percent were caused by these substances, and 50 percent of the estimated 2.1 million years of life lost due to drug use disorders or premature deaths were caused by these substances.
Nonmedical use of synthetic opioids exacerbates public health crisis

In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the crisis is driven by tramadol; in North America, it is fentanyl. The two regions have almost nothing in common in terms of economic, demographic, or drug use patterns, but they are both struggling with an opioid crisis fueled by the availability and low cost of materials to produce them.
In North America, the use of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids has led to a surge in opioid overdose deaths over the past two decades.
In 2018, two thirds of the 67,367 overdose deaths recorded in the United States involved fentanyl.
Canada also reported similar findings, but at lower numbers.
Part of the reason fentanyl is causing overdose deaths is that it is unpredictable in the illicit drug market.
In West Africa, Central Africa, and North Africa, the market for nonmedical use of tramadol has grown substantially.
In the region, there has been a growing use of tramadol for the treatment of the condition.
In 2017, global seizures of tramadol increased significantly, peaking at more than 12,500 tons.
However, in 2018, global seizures fell to 32 tons after India passed a new law regulating tramadol.

The crisis in both places was fueled by the ease of manufacture and low cost of production, as well as the lack of international regulation of tramadol and many fentanyl-like substances or their precursors.
What exacerbates the crisis in both regions is that these substances are available on both the pharmaceutical and illicit markets, making it harder to detect and prevent their abuse.
Stimulant use continues to rise
The cocaine and methamphetamine markets are the most significant in the world of stimulants, and both substances are seeing increased use in their primary markets.
About 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, as it is quite popular in North America and Western Europe.
Some 27 million people used amphetamines in the same year, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used ATS in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to most indicators, the use of methamphetamine in these two regions has been expanding for two decades.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist and sometimes substitute for each other, with the use of one drug rising as the use of the other falls, and sometimes both increasing and decreasing to meet the same market demand.
COVID-19 increases risk for injecting drug users
An estimated 11.3 million people inject drugs, and around 10% of global HIV infections are attributed to injecting drug use.
More than 1 million people who inject drugs are living with HIV, and 5.5 million have hepatitis C.
In 2017, there were around 585,000 drug-related deaths, half of which were caused by liver disease caused by hepatitis C, which is still largely untreated among injecting drug users.

5 The shortage of opioids caused by COVID-19 restrictions may lead users to substitute with more readily available substances, such as alcohol or benzodiazepines, or to mix opioids with synthetic drugs.
As some users switch to injecting or inject more frequently, more harmful use patterns may emerge.

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Official: The Process of Acceptance is a Bottleneck - Ecns.cn
EU summit for refugee policy is full of disputes, EU official: every step of the reception process is a bottleneck

[Global Times reporter in Belgium, Niu Rifeng] According to a report by Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit on that day, the President of the European Commission, Von der Leyen, said that the EU leaders agreed to issue stricter policies on illegal immigration, so that it would be easier to expel illegal immigrants.

The EU's move is reportedly a response to the growing problem of illegal immigration in Europe. Now, the EU's core problem is that the number of illegal immigrants who can eventually be repatriated is very small.
According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen external borders with infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been at odds over issues such as the cost of the fence.
Von der Leyen has repeatedly said that EU funds will not pay for the costs.

But some diplomats from member states said that if the EU could share the installation of cameras, observation towers and other infrastructure along the external border, it would free up national budgets and speed up the construction process.

According to the European Euractiv website, EU officials admitted that every step of the refugee reception process was bottlenecked, and the limited reception capacity and the overburdened immigration authorities of member states could not stop refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in EU countries, and the EU's refugee reception system was in a "permanent crisis".
According to the European Commission, Schengen countries received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, nearly half of which were more than the previous year.
Meanwhile, the EU recorded more than 330,000 illegal border crossings last year.
In this context, the summit also agreed on a "principle" that EU countries can deport illegal immigrants back to their home countries based on the judgments of the courts of another member state.
In addition, the report said that EU leaders also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which will pave the way for the EU to establish a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Niu Rifeng)

First batch of personal pension investment products launched, with a minimum holding period of 360 days - chinanews.com
First batch of personal pension investment products on sale
Seven products from home institutions can be selected, and the minimum holding period is 360 days.
Personal pension investment products have finally been launched.

On February 10, China Finance Network released the list of the first batch of personal pension investment products, and the seven personal pension investment products of Guangdong Rural Commercial Bank, Agricultural Bank of China, and China Postal Savings were officially launched.

Thus, the "shelves" of personal pension accounts are finally filled with four types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension investment, personal pension insurance, and publicly-traded personal pension funds.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension investment products are all publicly-traded net asset value open-end products, of which 5 are new products and 2 are existing products, and except for one product that is a mixed type product, the other 6 products are all fixed income type products.

The Beijing Youth Daily reporter found that among the five newly issued products, four were from China Merchants Securities, all of which were fixed income products, with the shortest holding period of 365 days, 540 days, 720 days and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% -

The remaining new product is "China Postal Savings Wealth Adds Lustre Huaqing Shortest Holding 1095 Days 1 ", which is also a fixed income product. It started to collect on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is grade 2.

Among the two existing products, one is Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management’s “Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management Harmony · Innovative 360-day Technology Innovation RMB Wealth Management Product”, which is a mixed type investment product with a risk level of three.

The other existing product is “China Post Wealth Enrichment Add Lustre to Precious Jade Shortest Holding Period 365 Days 1”, which is a fixed income type, and started to collect funds on December 30 last year, and officially started to operate on January 4 this year, with a cumulative net value of 1.0011 on February 8.

According to the Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Individual Pension Funds, the financial products that the funds of individual pension accounts can invest in include bank wealth management, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, publicly-traded funds, and others.
The first batch of personal pension investment products were sold, marking the official launch of personal pension investors to purchase investment products through personal pension fund accounts.
In November last year, the SAFE issued the Interim Measures for the Management of Personal Pension Business of Commercial Banks and Securities Companies.

The Measures stipulate that participants can purchase personal pension products through personal pension fund accounts, including personal pension savings, personal pension investment products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance, and the State Administration of Taxes issued a notice, which clarified that the individual pension system would be implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, and Hebei Shijiazhuang and Xiong’an New Area, and Jincheng City, Shanxi.
By the end of 2022, the number of individual pension participants was 19.54 million, and the number of payers was 61.3 million, with a total payment of RMB14.2 billion.
Previously, the banks participating in the pilot only offered three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and public pension fund products.
Now that the personal pension investment products have also arrived, how should investors choose?

Experts from the research and development department of China Merchants Securities said that compared with other personal pension products, the pilot-phase pension investment products and personal pension investment products have three characteristics.

First, it is safe. The risk management mechanism is more complete, the investment strategy and concept are more safe, and the independent custody by a third party other than the parent bank is implemented.

Secondly, it is long-term. The duration of the pilot-phase pension investment products is all over 5 years, and the minimum holding period of the next-to-be-issued personal pension investment products is 1 year, and holding for more than 3 years is encouraged.

Three, it is affordable. The purchase threshold of the products is low, and the starting point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The custody fee, management fee, and other fees of the products are more favorable.
Experts pointed out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the products and their own risk tolerance.

Personal pension savings have the characteristics of long-term, high interest rates, and high safety, which are suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; personal pension insurance products focus on guarantees, which are suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and can accept stable returns; while personal pension investment products and publicly-offered fund products do not guarantee the principal or returns, have certain investment risks, but have higher expected returns, which are

The Fitness Industry Should Overcome the Trust Crisis - Ecns.cn
Another large gym “bombs”?
Recently, the member rights protection issue of the famous fitness organization, Zhongjian Fitness Club, has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally, and then rumors about the bankruptcy and running away of the organization caused members to panic, leading to the involvement of public security and human resources departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the organization responded and promised to try their best to safeguard the legitimate rights and interests of employees and members, and the storm was finally calmed down.

Some of the stores of individual fitness institutions have encountered operating problems and are temporarily closed. Consumers could calmly wait for the problem to be solved. Why is the first reaction of many members "something is wrong"?
The club member rights protection storm behind the fitness club is a deep-seated problem of industry trust crisis.
Domestic traditional gyms generally adopt the prepaid model, and "making money from users who do not come" is the underlying logic of its development.

The cash flow was obtained through the pre-sale of membership cards, and the continuous opening of new stores seemed to be able to cycle, but in fact, it was eating the rice of the year, and it could not form a stable profit model.
The frequent negative news about gyms running away has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the market prospect, gyms are certainly a good business with “money-making” potential.
The fitness industry has had its ups and downs, but it has always been a focus of capital.
Multiple data show that the hotness of the fields such as fitness consumption is rising, and the market is recovering.

Specifically in the fitness market, as the residents’ living standards have been steadily improving, the concept of healthy life has been deeply rooted in people’s hearts, and the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the quality of development.

However, some institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the recovery of consumption, and just as they are coming out of the crisis, they are blowing the horn of expansion and investing all their financing funds in new store construction.

It is undeniable that many institutions have withdrawn in the past few years due to the epidemic, and the industry has reshuffled. At this time, powerful enterprises have selectively increased their acquisition strength and rearranged their layout, and there is no shortage of new opportunities.

However, for the development of the fitness market to enter into a virtuous cycle and step onto the prosperous and long-term development path, the industry must change the traditional mode and change the operating strategy.
Only by consolidating and rebuilding consumer confidence and safety, can we truly win the market and win the future.
Instead of rushing to open new stores to grab market share, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing services and using high-quality development to stabilize users.
First, we need to rely on services to retain users.
Gyms belong to the service industry, and their essence is to adhere to “user-oriented”, to focus on user needs, and to put the operational focus on improving the quality of services.
Secondly, digital transformation can improve user experience.
For example, the current popular Internet gym model, which allows users to pay per session and choose their own location.
At the same time, the physical data and the exercise data can be effectively used, and the social needs can be met, realizing the complete service loop from online to offline.
Without personalized promotion and without expensive annual cards, users’ concerns about gyms “running away” are reduced, and their trust is also enhanced.
In addition, we should actively explore multiple business models.

Now, sports consumption has moved from single services to scene consumption, and fitness clubs are expected to become a new entry point for consumption. Surrounding products such as sports supplements and fitness equipment that meet the needs of fitness will become a new profit point, providing consumers with more choices.
Ginger Tianqi

“Discount Payment” Reappears in Nanjing Real Estate Market - Ecns.cn

Yangtze Evening Post (Reporter: Ma Zhupo) Yangtze Evening Post/Zi Niu News Reporter found out from an interview on the 10th that the “price guarantee agreement” that had not been seen for more than ten years has returned to the Nanjing real estate market. A real estate project in the Jiangbei New Area claimed “price guarantee”, and the developer was willing to replace the buyer’s home and return the
The conditions of the “price guarantee agreement” are not few.

The property, located in Jiangbei New District, is called Yanzhi Yuzhuoyun Pavilion, and Sun, a visitor to the property, told the reporter that he found a “statement” when he visited the property last weekend.

The photos he sent to the reporter showed that the developer of the project promised that if the buyers purchased the property between February 1 and February 28, the developer would replace the property with other properties that offered better discounts (limited to other unsold properties that belonged to the same type of property, the same floor, the same unit, and the same type of property) and return the difference in price from the previous discount from the date of signing the purchase contract to

Mr. Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this was actually a "price guarantee agreement", which was to make buyers feel at ease and not worry about the developer's price reduction promotion, "now I'm afraid that after buying it, it will be reduced in price, and I will be in trouble at the sales office, but if I don't make trouble, it will be a real headache."
Many buyers also believe that the "price guarantee agreement" is a kind of "confidence booster" for buyers, but the conditions are not low.

Ms. Zheng, who is planning to buy a house in Jiangbei, said that the house with the price guarantee must be of the same type, in the same building and the same unit, and there are not many houses for comparison, so the "threshold" is still high.
Some buyers also believe that because of the information asymmetry, the developer may give extra discounts when selling, and it is not easy for buyers to "protect their rights".
It remains to be seen whether the buyers will stay.

The reporter found on the Nanjing online real estate website that the project sold 252 units in two buildings in November last year, with floor areas of 105 square meters, 114 square meters, and 129 square meters, and the average selling price of fully furnished units was RMB 39,843 per square meter.

However, more than two months have passed, and online real estate shows that the current total number of unsold units in the project is 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 8 units in total, 128 units are unsold, and 44 units are unsold in 7 units, and the total number of transactions in the project is only 33 units, accounting for only 13%.
Market insiders said that "price maintenance agreements" had also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the Huangshan Road property in the Heqing district launched a “price guarantee plan” to attract buyers, which stated that “the company solemnly promises that if the project’s discount range is expanded within a year, the company will return the difference to the old owners according to the difference”.
After that, in April 2011, nine projects in Nanjing also promised to pay the difference in price for a portion of their housing stock.
"The property market is recovering, and we need a "strong medicine" at this time.
"The price guarantee agreement" is also one of the marketing methods of real estate companies, said Shen, a senior real estate broker in Nanjing.
He believes that developers need confidence more than buyers, and the launch of the "price guarantee agreement" is actually to boost their confidence.
As for whether the buyers will stay, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as the control policies and the loan threshold, and it is still to be observed.

Exports of 11 major export goods also fell compared with the same period last year.
The decline was the deepest in plastic and rubber products and optical instruments, with year-on-year falls of 37.6% and 35.7%, respectively.
The export of electronic components fell by 20.1% year on year, the largest decline in 11 years.
Among them, the integrated circuit fell 18.3% year-on-year, the largest drop in 14 years.
Department of Statistics Director Chai Mei-nan said that this shows the weak demand effect of the consumer electronics industry and the electronics industry entering the correction period.
Statistics show that in January, the import and export of the Taiwan region fell by double digits, with only US$2.34 billion of excess gold, the lowest level in nearly three years.

The Taiwan authorities’ financial affairs department believes that the global terminal demand has decreased, the industry adjustment of inventory has suppressed the willingness of manufacturers to purchase raw materials, and the export slump is difficult to improve in the short term, and the export decline in the first quarter of this year in Taiwan is likely to be higher than expected.

According to the release of the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the Taiwan Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) in January of this year was 40.4% after seasonal adjustment, a 3.3% drop from December last year, and a contraction for seven consecutive months.

In the economic monitoring indicator system, the PMI is 50% as the threshold line, and the index is greater than 50%, which represents the expansion of the economy, and vice versa, which represents contraction.
Among the five components of the Taiwan PMI in January, new orders, production and human resources were tightened, and the delivery time of suppliers was reduced, and inventories were tightened.

All six industries reported a contraction in PMI, and the industries were ranked in order of contraction speed as the electricity and mechanical equipment industry (35.1%), the electronic and optical industry (35.2%), the chemical and biotechnology industry (39.2%), the basic raw material industry (42.4%), the transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and the food and textile industry (45

In terms of prices, the "Directorate General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics" of the Taiwan authorities announced that the annual growth rate of Taiwan's CPI in January of this year was 3.04%, which has exceeded 3% since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables rose by 28.25%, which was a new high in 17 months.

Cai Zhenghong, a special commissioner of the "Directorate General of Budget, Accounting and Statistics" of Taiwan, said that the price increase of vegetables was indeed beyond expectations, excluding the factors of the Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February of this year should be close to 2.71% in December of last year, and the inflation pressure still exists and is still at a high point.
Looking ahead to Taiwan’s economy this year, experts are pessimistic, according to reports by domestic media such as the United Daily News and Yahoo Finance.

Professor Wu Daren of the Economics Department of National Central University in Taiwan analyzed that the decline in exports may cause problems with cash flow for export manufacturers, and the risk of debt default will increase.
At the same time, the reduction of orders leads to the reduction of labor costs by manufacturers, which affects the labor market and household economy, and in turn affects the consumption capacity.

Chiu Dasheng, a research fellow at the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved, and demand continues to shrink, so it is estimated that the decline in Taiwan's exports will continue into the first half of the year.
As Taiwan's economy relies on exports, the impact of the low exports will affect the economic growth performance of the whole year.

Henan Province Regulates and Integrates Prices of Dental Implant Medical Services - Ecns.cn
CCTV News: Dental implants are the ideal choice for many patients with missing teeth, but the price of up to tens of thousands of yuan per tooth has always made many patients hesitate.
Since this year, with the accelerated implementation of the collection of implant teeth, various places have also put the reduction of implant teeth prices on the agenda.

From February 10, the medical service price of a single conventional implant in Henan Province is controlled at 4,300 yuan, and the cost of a single conventional implant is no more than 97% of the control target.
Dental implants refer to a method of tooth restoration that is based on the insertion of a lower structure into the bone tissue to support and fix the upper tooth restoration.
The reporter learned from the First Affiliated Hospital of Zhengzhou University that the price for a single regular implant, from implantation to final repair, is about 16,700 yuan.
Patient He Wei: After the new policy, the doctor told me that for my case, it would be around 8,000 yuan, less than 10,000 yuan, and I could save about half.

On the basis of the existing projects, Henan Province has also integrated and determined 15 price items for oral implant-related medical services, including “implantation fee (per unit)”, and has unified the price and payment categories for public medical institutions under the provincial government, and has canceled or adjusted 20 price items for medical services, such as implantation of the implant.

Li Yunjie, Director of the Pharmaceutical Price and Tendering Procurement Department of the Zhengzhou Municipal Health Insurance Bureau, said that the main beneficiaries were the four parties: the health insurance system, which would have lower expenditures; hospitals, which would have lower pressure; patients, who would have more appropriate increases; suppliers, who would have a market; and patients, who would benefit the most
Shenzhen: Building the First and the Most Advanced Ultra-Fast Pioneer City in China - chinanews.com

China News Service, February 11 (Reporter Liu Xiaoyu) According to the WeChat public account of "Shenzhen Industry and Information Technology" on the 10th, the Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology recently issued the "Shenzhen Action Plan for Building a Fast-paced Pioneer City".

Among them, it is proposed that by the end of 2023, a super broadband network with high speed, large capacity, and low latency will be built, and the network construction goals of “double gigabits, all-optical network, 1 millisecond, and everything connected” will be achieved, creating the world’s first and China’s leading city of ultra-speed.
The plan proposes to accelerate the upgrade of Gigabit optical networks.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-fiber industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires that the energy efficiency of 5G networks be comprehensively improved.
Research and develop Shenzhen 5G network service quality standards, conduct 5G network test evaluation, and improve the quality of 5G network services.

Support basic telecommunications enterprises to increase the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and places, with 10,000 new 5G base stations added throughout the year, with an average download speed of 500Mbps and an upload speed of 100Mbps in the city, with a download speed of 1000Mbps and an upload speed of 200Mbps in key areas,
Build high-quality wireless local area networks at the city level.

Develop public WLAN service standards, promote the upgrading of WLAN in areas with high concentration of people and information consumption demand in all districts of the city, and provide 1G access capabilities.

Build a unified authentication and management platform for public wireless local area networks in the city based on the “Shenzhen Internet” construction, and achieve “one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching”, and support the operating entities to include self-built APs (wireless access points) with public service capabilities in the authentication and management platform.
Upgrade the total quantity of access points to no less than 20,000 by the end of 2023.

In addition, the plan also proposes to build high-quality all-optical power networks, construct multi-layered computing power supply systems, accelerate the construction of key communication network facilities, and enhance Internet application service capabilities.
The plan clearly states that it will collaborate to build a smart perception system.

Explore the construction and management model of urban perception terminals based on the “Open Horizon” operating system, reduce the cost of interconnection, accelerate the construction of urban-level perception platforms, and promote the interconnection and interconnection of urban perception platforms, specialized perception platforms in various fields, and data.

Deepen the application of the Internet of Things and sensing in the fields of urban management, public services, public security, transportation, and so on, and expand the fixed sensing and smart network channels of urban roads, buildings, public facilities, and so on, as well as the sensing channels of smart vehicles.

By the end of 2023, the number of water, electricity, gas, and Internet of Things sensing terminals will exceed 9 million, and 20 multi-functional smart lamppost application pilot projects will be built.

The plan also mentioned that it will strengthen the integration of satellite and terrestrial communication applications, build the infrastructure of low-altitude networks, and promote the in-depth coverage of 5G networks at sea.
At the same time, it will promote the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea, build an industrial innovation development ecosystem, and support the hosting of top-level events and activities.

China’s e-commerce industry is seeing a “new variable”, how can delivery companies achieve “content is king”?
-Chinanews
China News Service, February 11 (Reporter: Liu Xiaoyu) -- China's e-commerce industry is seeing the emergence of "new variables", and how can delivery companies ensure that "content is king"?
China News Service reporter Xia Bin
"We entered the e-commerce market late, but from the very beginning, we realized that content is very important if you want to stand out from the millions of stores.
"A '90s girl' from Guangdong, Fangfang, now operates a store selling healthy food ingredients on TikTok, and has helped a brick-and-mortar store with more than 30 years of history "bloom" online.
She opened the @Fangfang1 account on Douyin, which is a video sharing app, and uploaded a video with the classic Cantonese song, which is a copy of the old Hong Kong movie soundtrack.

At the recent TikTok e-commerce "Finding Peers·Sharing Quality Content" event, Fang Fang, as a representative of quality creators, spoke on the stage to introduce her daily creation experience and insights.

She said at the scene: "The carefully polished video has gained a lot of attention from netizens, and many people are interested in the ingredients in my family, and want to cook with me, and the sales have opened up suddenly. "

With the soup video, Fangfang let more people fall in love with the "old Guangzhou flavor", and a live broadcast sold up to 300,000 pieces of rejuvenating food, saving the family's store from the brink of bankruptcy.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the continuous development of short video and live e-commerce, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early days of live streaming sales, the live broadcast rooms often used low price discounts to attract users, and the price advantage seemed to be the only selling point at the time.

In recent years, there are many phenomenal Vs such as Liu Yahong and Zhan Zhuang, as well as many unknown people who are experts and merchants in vertical sub-fields. They have continuously created high-quality content that suits their brand style, and have improved their long-term operating efficiency.

Haoyang, the operation manager of the KOLs of the TikTok e-commerce, said that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have transformed their content through the TikTok e-commerce, and their content creation volume has increased by 252%, and the total transaction amount has more than doubled.
"Behind these figures, we can feel the thriving and vibrant author ecosystem.
"High Yaxing said. "

Beijing Normal University’s Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform previously released the “ECHI Report” on the content ecology health index of the e-commerce industry, which analyzed the importance of “new variables” - quality content - in the current e-commerce industry from the data dimension, and used the index to evaluate the content ecology situation of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the ranking of the ECHI of the e-commerce industry content ecology health index in the above report, Douyin, Tik Tok, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked in the top five.

The report believes that the content ecology in the e-commerce industry is a comprehensive concept, which integrates e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce, only good PGC (professional content production) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers for integration with e-commerce, the higher the value of the content platform, the richer the scenarios for consumption and promotion, the higher the possibility of e-

On the scene, Professor Qi Guoming, a professor at the School of Journalism and Communication of Beijing Normal University and the chairman of the Chinese Media Economics and Management Special Committee, analyzed and interpreted the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the current e-commerce industry has already transitioned from "consumer accessibility" to "consumer quality", and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental and handle of the new stage of the development of e-commerce, and knowledge payment, professional knowledge, PGC content (Key Opinion Leaders) and so on have begun to become the standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking ahead to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Qi Guoming made two suggestions.

One is from the perspective of improving the content structure, promoting the overall improvement of the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecology, creating positive content creation and management standards, and realizing the dynamic balance of the health index and the e-commerce content ecology.
Another is to look at the external ecology, to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value coordination and joint creation of the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry still needs more data and artificial intelligence support to form a prediction for the stability of future development; in addition, to provide merchants with a more regulated and healthy growth space, to achieve the value coordination of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and to create a healthy content ecology.

The Shares and Bonds Trading Business of the Beijing Stock Exchange to Launch Next Week - chinanews.com

Beijing News (Reporter: Sun Jie) Yesterday evening, the Beijing Stock Exchange announced that the Beijing Stock Exchange’s securities lending and securities borrowing business will be officially launched on February 13, 2020, and that securities companies that have obtained the right to conduct securities lending and securities borrowing business at the Beijing Stock Exchange can accept investors’ entrustment
The list of the first 56 financing and stock lending target stocks was determined based on the calculation date of January 31, 2023.

The Beijing Stock Exchange said that the list of stocks for the financing and stock lending business and the list of securities that can be used as collateral will be published through the "Information Disclosure - Financing and Stock Lending Information" column on the official website of the Beijing Stock Exchange, which will facilitate investors to inquire.
The financing and securities lending business is an important basic institution of the securities market, and is also a relatively mature trading method in the international securities market.
On September 2, 2019, the Beijing Stock Exchange announced that it would publicly solicit opinions on the financing and securities lending business on the first anniversary of its establishment.

The launch of the RFQ trading at the Beijing Stock Exchange is an important measure to promote the continuous construction of the market system, improve the trading mechanism and enhance the pricing function of the secondary market.

The financing and stock lending system will benefit investors' trading strategies, meet the diversified trading needs of investors, promote the discovery of market prices, and further improve market liquidity.

In the next step, the Beijing Stock Exchange will continue to do its job well in all aspects of financing and securities business under the leadership of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, to enrich the trading system tools as guided by the investor demand, perfect the relevant supporting mechanism, and focus on building a first-class stock exchange that serves innovative small and medium-sized enterprises.

Chinese rescue team continues rescue operations in Turkey, rescuing 4 people trapped - chinanews.com

ECNS.com, February 11 -- According to the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management on February 11, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team dispatched three action teams and 45 rescuers to search for and rescue people in Turkey, and rescued one person.
At the same time, two search and evaluation teams were dispatched to evaluate and investigate 15 buildings on Vodabashi Street.
So far, a total of 4 people have been rescued, 5 people have been found dead, and 25 severely damaged buildings have been assessed for signs of life and risk.
The rescue team will adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation and the rescue scene of the disaster area, and continue to carry out the rescue work.

The rescue team obtained information about the request for rescue through various channels, such as the embassy, the local government, and the United Nations rescue organization, and verified the information through online inquiries and on-site searches.
and introduced the current rescue environment and the collapse of buildings to the Chinese Hong Kong Rescue Team, and jointly carried out search operations.

At present, the Chinese rescue team is jointly responsible for the regional coordination (SSC5) with the Italian rescue team, and has sent 3 members to participate in the work of the 5th regional rescue coordination center, communicated with the Italian, British, Serbian, Slovakian, and Omani teams, and understood the rescue work of the United Nations rescue organization and the rescue teams of various countries.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team protection, and strengthened safety control at the rescue site in accordance with the principle of "unified command, safety first", and strengthened the requirements for rescue work discipline and clarified safety precautions.
The shift duty and watchtower work system is continuously implemented, and the camp safety management is strengthened.

The medical personnel of the rescue team provide daily physical examination services for the team members, and strengthen the medical guarantee for key personnel. At present, all members of the rescue team are in good health, and they carry out disinfection in the camp.

After the self-built camp was established, the logistics support team members built 26 tents of four categories, including command communication, equipment storage, medical washing and disinfection, living accommodation, and kennels, to ensure the more than 30 sets of rescue equipment.

(Deutsche Welle) The Biden administration on Friday (February 10) blacklisted six Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the balloon espionage program.

The U.S. Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institution helped the Chinese military modernize, especially in aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist have difficulty obtaining US technology exports.
The list, known as the "entity list," bars companies on it from purchasing technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they receive special export licenses from the U.S. Commerce Department.

The companies on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanyang Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., China Electronics Technology Group Corporation 48th Research Institute, Longjiang Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Longmen Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.
The White House had previously said it was considering broader measures to "expose and address" China's larger-scale surveillance activities that it said posed a threat to U.S. national security.
The balloon incident has caused further tension between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Blinken canceled his visit to China.

China's government lodged a solemn representation to the US embassy in China on February 4 after the US shot down the balloon, criticizing the US for seriously damaging and undermining the efforts and progress of stabilizing the Sino-US relations.

Based on the existing debris evidence and the information of the Chinese military's procurement platform, the U.S. government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon "has a direct relationship with the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is an approved supplier of the Chinese military.

Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Ma Xiaoguang said at a press conference on Friday that China has explained the situation and clarified its position on the accidental entry of a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle into the US airspace due to force majeure.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress is purely political manipulation and fabrication.
China is firmly opposed to and strongly dissatisfied with that.

"Today's action demonstrates our joint commitment to identify and disrupt China's use of spy balloons, which have violated the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries," said Matthew Axelrod, the assistant secretary of commerce for export enforcement.
"We will continue to work with our allies and partners to counter the threat posed by these balloons."
A worker at Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Science and Technology Co. Ltd. told Reuters he was not aware of the sanctions and declined to comment further.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States and the Chinese Consulate General in Houston have not commented on the information.
(Reuters)
