(Deutsche Welle) Days after a quake hit parts of Turkey and Syria, hopes of finding survivors are dwindling, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday brought relief to the search and rescue teams.

According to the Associated Press, the family of five was rescued after more than five days of being trapped under the rubble in the town of Nurdağı in Gaziantep province, which was one of the hardest hit areas.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the rubble, and then found the father, who insisted on rescuing his son and another daughter first.
When they were all rescued, the crowd erupted in cheers.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old man were also rescued in the harsh winter conditions.
"What day is it today?
" - The boy, who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours, asked the rescuers who brought him back to the ground after he was rescued.
A man in Kahramanmaras holds his cat after it was rescued
The miraculous successes of the rescue operation have brought a glimmer of hope to the already desperate search, but the number of missing people is also rising.
So far, according to official statistics, more than 20,000 people have died in Turkey on Monday's earthquake, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Although experts say that people can survive up to a week after being trapped in rubble, the hope of finding more survivors is becoming more and more slim.
Rescue workers are still using thermal imaging cameras to search for signs of life beneath the rubble.
Meanwhile, the focus of the rescue effort is shifting to helping those survivors who are in desperate need of help.
UN official: Disaster in the region "unprecedented in a century"

The UN's Under Secretary General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator Martin Griffiths said at a press conference in Turkey that the earthquake was the "worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's response to the disaster as "unusual."
He also told a Reuters reporter that he hoped to be able to provide aid to areas controlled by the Syrian government and opposition forces, but said that the matter was "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged an additional $25 million in relief funds for people affected by the earthquake in Syria.
Earlier this week, the United Nations announced $25 million in funding for Turkey and Syria.
The most devastating earthquakes in the world in the last 60 years
Chile , Pacific Rim
At 3:11 p.m. local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by human beings struck Valdivia, Chile, with a magnitude of 9.5.
Within ten minutes, the entire city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The tremor caused localised tsunamis that severely battered the Chilean coast, with waves up to 25 metres (82 ft).
Waves as high as 10.7 metres (35 ft) were recorded 10,000 kilometres (6,200 mi) from the epicenter, and as far away as Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The most destructive earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Alaska's Good Friday earthquake
March 27, 1964, was a Friday, and Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in North American history struck Alaska, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake in recorded history.
When the earthquake struck, a fault between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate ruptured near Prince William Sound, near College Fjord.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The seafloor displacement triggered a massive tsunami, which was 67 metres high.
Schools and many businesses were closed because it was a holiday.
The quake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, and the other 130 died from the tsunami it triggered.
The most devastating earthquakes in the world in the last 60 years
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two strong earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above hit Tangshan, Hebei Province, China, and Fengnan County within 16 hours.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers below the surface.
Tangshan's entire transportation, communication, water supply, and electricity were cut off, and the city was leveled in an instant.
The capital city of Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt the strong tremors.
According to official statistics, 242,769 people died and 164,851 were seriously injured in the earthquake in all the affected areas, including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second deadliest earthquake in China's history, second only to the Jiajing earthquake in 1556.
However, some foreign scientists estimated that this earthquake may have caused at least 650,000 deaths.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Indian Ocean earthquake (2004)
On December 26, 2004, a 9.1 to 9.3 magnitude earthquake occurred 160 kilometers west of the Aceh province of Sumatra, Indonesia, with a depth of 30 kilometers.
The earthquake triggered a massive tsunami with waves as high as 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected, with the worst-hit areas including Aceh province in Indonesia, Thailand's Hat Yai and Phuket resort areas, Sri Lanka and the Indian state of Tamil Nadu.

The region was in the midst of the Christmas holiday season, and the area was crowded with tourists and locals, which led to many beachgoers and locals working on the coast being swept away by the tsunami, making the earthquake a disaster with many missing.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people died and went missing.
the most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan earthquake, 2008
On May 12, 2008, a massive earthquake struck the Sichuan province in China.

According to the data of China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2 degrees and the moment magnitude reached 8.3 degrees, and the destroyed area exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had caused 69,227 deaths, 17,923 missing persons, 374,643 people with different degrees of injuries, 199,300 people without homes, and a total of 46.256 million people affected.
It is the most destructive earthquake since the founding of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualties after the earthquake in Tangshan.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that it would declare May 12 of each year as the Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, and strengthen the education of the public and the attention to disaster prevention and reduction work.
Since then, the governments and primary and secondary schools in many parts of China have held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Middle and primary schools also began to pay attention to popularizing "earthquake prevention and mitigation" education.
the most destructive earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, Haiti, a Caribbean island country, was hit by an earthquake with a magnitude of 7.0.
The epicenter was located 25 kilometers southwest of the capital Port-au-Prince, and the earthquake had a magnitude of about 13 kilometers.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The Haitian government has reported more than 200,000 confirmed deaths.
In some areas of Haiti, up to 90% of homes were destroyed in the earthquake.
Although the international community provided a large amount of assistance and support, this overpopulated and corrupt poor country has never recovered from this disaster.
The most devastating earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Category: 2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami
On March 11, 2011, a magnitude 9.0 megathrust earthquake struck off the coast of northeastern Japan.

The epicenter was located in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the earthquake had a depth of 24 km, and triggered a massive tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
It was the first earthquake in Japan to have a magnitude of over 9 since the country began keeping records.
Approximately 22,000 people died in the disaster, and around 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami and suffered a leakage accident.
The incident was classified as the most serious of the seven levels in the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident led to the detection of trace amounts of radioactive material around the world, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (with a half-life of 30 years).
Large amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the nuclear accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster zones of Syria and Turkey are in urgent need of food.
In Syria alone, up to 5.3 million people have lost their homes due to the earthquake.
The World Food Programme has appealed for $77 million to provide food for people displaced by the earthquake in Turkey and Syria.
Temperatures in the affected areas are currently as low as minus 10 degrees Celsius, and many people have no homes.
The Turkish government has distributed large amounts of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies are still reaching too few of the people in desperate need of help.
In Syria, where the civil war has raged for 12 years, the earthquake has added to the misery of the population.
In the four days after the earthquake, WFP has already provided food assistance to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) has sent 72 tons of medical supplies for trauma care and emergency surgery.
(Associated Press, Reuters, etc.)

NEWS GOV-MO: Police Alert: Police Department Warns of Imposter Telephone Company Scam Texts

The Police have received several reports of telephone scams recently, where offenders pose as local telecommunications companies to send victims a text message with a link to a fake website, offering a prize or reward that must be claimed urgently to lure victims into entering their personal details into the fake website.

The victims were instructed to enter their credit card details and verification codes, and were then informed by the financial institution that there were unknown transactions on their credit card, and that their credit card details had been stolen from the website.
Investigations have confirmed that the relevant telecommunications companies did not send the above SMS messages.

The Police urge the public to be vigilant when receiving similar mobile phone messages and not to click on the links in the messages or provide any personal information. If you are asked to provide credit card details, account transaction passwords or transaction verification codes, you should be doubly cautious and prevent your credit card from being stolen and used fraudulently.
Fraud Alert:
1. Pay attention to network security information and enhance personal prevention awareness;
2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the website, so as to prevent theft;
3. Be vigilant against fake websites and fishing websites, and always pay attention to whether the website address is completely consistent with the official website;
4. Install and update the latest anti-virus software on your mobile phone, mobile device or computer regularly;

5. If you suspect that you have been scammed or involved in other crimes, you should immediately call the Police Fraud Investigation Hotline at 8800 7777 or the Crime Reporting Hotline at 993 for assistance.

Xinhua News Agency, Beijing, February 10 - General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, state president and CMC Chairman Xi Jinping sent a letter to the 19th batch of Chinese medical team members who were aiding the Central African Republic on February 9, and extended his greetings to them and all the medical teams aiding foreign countries, and expressed his sincere hope.

The medical assistance is an important content of our foreign assistance.
In 1963, China dispatched the first medical team to Algeria.

Google AI chatbot "answered wrong questions" and its parent company's stock price evaporated by billions of dollars.
(Comprehensive report on the 11th)

Google's new artificial intelligence chatbot Bard has suffered a setback, with the wrong answer in a promotional video causing the share price of the company's parent Alphabet to plummet 8.9% on Thursday, falling below the $100 mark and wiping out $110 billion (RM476.5 billion) in market value, closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is worried that Alphabet is not as good as its competitor Microsoft.

According to a report by Reuters, Google earlier released a promotional video of its AI chatbot Bard on social media, in which a person asked Bard: "Can you tell me what the new discoveries of the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) are for a 9-year-old child?
In its response, Bard mentioned that the telescope had taken the first photo of an exoplanet.
However, according to data from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photo of an exoplanet was taken by the Very Large Telescope of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters also reported the story with the headline "Alphabet shares plunge after Bard's wrong answer".

On the other hand, Google pointed out that Bard's response "emphasizes the importance of rigorous testing process", and will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response "meets high standards on the basis of quality, safety and authentic information".
Singapore Tourism Rebounds Strongly, with Inbound Visitors Up 19 Times Compared to 2021

(Comprehensive report on the 11th) Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that the number of international tourists visiting Singapore in 2023 is expected to reach 12 million to 14 million, bringing tourism revenue of about 18 billion to 21 billion Singapore dollars; the number of tourists and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19
Singapore's tourism market has gradually restarted and recovered in 2022.

According to the latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board, the number of inbound tourists in 2022 increased 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million, exceeding the earlier estimate of 4 million to 6 million by the Board, and tourists have already recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore’s tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion Singapore dollars. It is estimated that the tourism revenue in 2022 will reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which is 6 to 7 times higher than 1.89 billion Singapore dollars in 2021, and has already recovered to about 50% to 52
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly S$500 million to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.
The Tourism Board recently announced that it will allocate NT$110 million from this budget in the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return.

To make health and wellness one of the highlights of Singapore's tourism, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an expression of interest activity on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness attraction on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Lingli, executive director of sports and wellness tourism at the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health at the top of their list of considerations.

Developing a health and wellness attraction in Marina South, which includes Gardens by the Bay and the Marina Barrage, is expected to contribute to Singapore's tourism and economy, allowing visitors to spend more time in Singapore.
Singapore Tourism Board chairman Cherng Ying Lon said that in the next few years, health and wellness will become an important component of Singapore's tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Board has been promoting health and wellness to the local public and international visitors over the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, providing the public with more than 130 types of health activities and experiences.
Singapore will continue to provide new travel experiences for tourists.

In addition to the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum, the Avatar world in Gardens by the Bay, the Central Beach Bazaar in Sentosa, the "Explore New Frontiers" exhibition hall added by the ArtScience Museum, and the outdoor theater newly built by the Night Safari, the Tourism Board will support the development and update of projects such as Jurong Bird Park, making Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

Singapore plans to establish industry standards related to the conference, exhibition and incentive travel industry for sustainable development by 2023, with a focus on improving waste treatment and carbon emissions, and further optimizing the travel environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport has seen a strong recovery in passenger traffic, with more than 150,000 passengers per day, about 1 million passengers per week, which is about 75% of the pre-pandemic level, and the number of airline employees has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

According to the data, from January to October 2022, Singapore has received 23.6 million tourists, accounting for 42% of the pre-pandemic period, and 170,000 flights have taken off and landed, accounting for 53% of the pre-pandemic period.
The fast recovery of tourism has also driven the recovery of the accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high expectations for the Chinese market.

According to Qiu Dan, assistant director of the International Department of the Singapore Tourism Board, a survey by a Chinese travel platform showed that Singapore’s safety index ranked among the top three in the world, which is also one of the reasons why Chinese tourists love Singapore.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, China had about 3.6 million tourists visiting Singapore every year.
With China's border policy relaxation, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists this year will recover to 30% to 60% of that in 2019.
Qiao Shudan pointed out that in the future, the Tourism Board will closely monitor the signals of China's further release of policies on outbound travel to cope with the changes in tourist demand.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms such as Trip.com and travel agencies, the Singapore Tourism Board will actively prepare to receive Chinese tourists in response to new trends in overseas travel in China.

Looking ahead to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that the tourism industry will recover faster than expected, as long as there is no significant recession affecting public income, and there is no new outbreak of a deadly pandemic on a large scale.
Kim Jong-un and his daughter interacted closely, while his wife was left out of the picture

(Combined Electronic News: On the evening of the 8th, North Korea held a military parade to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the founding of the army, and not only Kim Jong-un's daughter Kim Ju-ae attended, but also stood on the podium with her father.

North Korean official media released a video on the 9th, showing Kim Ju Ae leaning on her father's side, looking affectionately and whispering to him several times. She gently hugged her father's cheeks with both hands and even touched her father's chest. The father-daughter interaction was broadcast to the whole country.
However, the first lady, Ri Sol-ju, had to stand aside.

According to the reports of the Korean “Korean News” and others, in the official photograph of Kim Jong-un and Ri Sol-ju couple with their daughter Kim Ju-ae attending the dinner on the 7th, not only did Ju-ae sit in the middle C position between her parents, but she also stood on the podium with Kim Jong-un at the military parade on the 8th.
The North Korean official media, "Korean Central Television," released the parade footage later, revealing more intimate scenes between the father and daughter.

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times on the podium, and their smiles never faded. They also whispered to each other in their ears. Kim Jong-un even lifted his daughter's hands to his cheeks, and Kim Jong-un responded with a bright smile.

Other official media images also show that Kim Ju Ae, while sitting on an indoor sofa with Kim Jong Un, continuously touched her father's face with her hand; while walking with her father, she touched his chest with her hand.
First Lady Ri Sol-ju was only able to walk behind or sit beside them, always a few steps away from her husband and daughter.

South Korean media pointed out that since Kim Ju Ae appeared in public for the first time on November 18, 2017, when she test-fired the Hwasong-17 missile, her exposure rate has been increasing for three months, and this is her fifth appearance at an official event.

The Korean official media referred to Kim Jong-un as the most beloved son and the most honored son, and also broadcasted the segment of Kim Jong-un repeatedly shouting his vow to support the bloodline of the founder while looking down at the parade from the podium.

These signs have led to speculation that Kim Jong-un has already decided to make Kim Jong-un his successor, and the Washington Post believes that "this is Kim Jong-un's signal to promote his middle school-aged daughter to the position of his successor," but there are also opinions that it is still too early to make such a judgment, and that there are still various possibilities in the situation where Kim Jong-un has a son.
Q&A: How to view the US January non-farm employment data exceeding expectations and future trends - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Q: How does Reign Investment view the US January non-farm employment data exceeding expectations and future trends?

A: On February 3, the US Department of Labor released the non-farm employment data for January 2023, with 517,000 new non-farm jobs, significantly higher than the market's expectation of 189,000; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, the lowest in nearly 50 years; the hourly wage growth rate was 4.4% year-on

In terms of the overall quantity, there are many one-time and technical factors that disturb the data, such as the return of strikers, the correction of the survey and statistical scope, the update of the seasonal factor, and the subsequent correction (refer to the January 2022 non-farm data, which was revised from 504,000 to 364,000), and non-farm employment may not be as

From a structural perspective, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises is still present, but the proportion is relatively low; the new employment in high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels, education and healthcare has increased significantly, and the data shows that the labor shortage in the service industry still exists.

Combining the rebound of service industry PMI, job vacancies and labor shortage data, which also exceeded expectations, and the strength of consumer credit data, we judge that the US service industry has experienced rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tight supply and demand of the US labor market will be difficult to improve without a recession.

At present, the US labor market still has a supply gap of more than 5 million, and the labor participation rate is slow to rise, especially the labor participation rate of 25-54 year olds has already approached the pre-epidemic high point.
In addition, the strong consumption demand will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the labor market due to the strong savings and consumer credit of US residents.
The continued tightness of the US labor market will be the backdrop of the US economy in 2023.
We are not optimistic about the continued decline in wage growth, given the current near-end of interest rate hikes, the continuous repetition of inflation expectations, and the end of the pandemic.
Prior to the release of this data, the US stock and bond market was overly optimistic about the Fed’s interest rate hike path.

As inflation data continued to improve, the Fed maintained a balance between shortening the pace of interest rate hikes and keeping the market's inflation expectations fragile, but the market ignored the Fed's hawkish statements and expected not only to stop raising interest rates earlier, but also to cut interest rates twice at the end of the year.

In the context of tight labor market supply and demand and the unclear impact of tightening policies, we believe that the Fed’s guidance on interest rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable, and the extreme adjustment and crowded trading expectations of the market may cause some harm to the market.

However, the stubbornness of wage growth is difficult to change in the current trend of rapid decline in inflation. With the M2 data turning negative year-on-year and the gradual improvement of various CPI leading indicators, the US CPI data has turned to a rapid decline since October, and the stubbornness of wage growth will only form a base for future inflation data, and the current market expectation is difficult to prove, and the market

In 1999, Sun Sun began to study the transformation of enterprises, and Zheng Yong Gang recalled that year, "We came to Shanghai to seek the transformation and asked many experts and scholars what to do, and we continuously held some Zhuge Liang meetings and Xu Luo seminars.

“Fund E Account” has arrived: CSRC authorizes the development of the realization of the aggregation and query of all funds held by investors - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observation Network Reporter Chen Xi: The complexity of the fund purchase channel makes it difficult to collect account information?
Always forgetting the “little treasury”?
These problems of the basic investors will be solved soon.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the "Fund E Account" app was uploaded to various mobile app stores and launched a public test.

As introduced, the “fund E account” provides a “one-stop” query service for individual investors’ public fund account and share information, aiming to solve the pain points of the industry, such as forgetting accounts and querying being cumbersome for the vast number of small and medium-sized investors.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 public fund management companies in the country, managing fund assets of about RMB2.6 trillion; 167 fund share registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
The account systems of each fund registration institution are independent, and there is no unified query channel in the industry.
Industry insiders said that at the end of 2021, China’s fund investors exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the country’s population invested in fund products.

Previously, investors needed to inquire about their purchase through different sales institutions, but through "fund E account", they can inquire about the purchase of all sales channels, and the holding of funds is clear at a glance.
What is the “Fund E Account” APP?

According to the relevant documents, the “fund E account” APP is a public fund industry portal mobile application developed and constructed by China Securities Regulatory Commission, which can provide investors with one-stop query of the off-market fund product shareholding situation of all public fund products in the market.

Investors can use the "fund E account" to conveniently and quickly grasp the holdings of the offshore fund products of the public fund products of the fund managers they have purchased through all sales channels in the market, and to comprehensively improve the query efficiency.

Specifically, investors can query the information through "fund account", including the fund account information opened at the public fund management institutions in the whole market, the transaction account information opened at the public fund sales institutions, and the holdings of the products, including the open-end fund, the collective asset management plan established by the securities company, and the number of investors is not limited to 200.

Liu Yicheng, the business responsible person of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told the Economic Observer that investors can know their holdings of all off-exchange public fund through the “Fund E-account” App, help them find “forgotten assets”, and more importantly, it helps customers to collect comprehensive fund investment information, help customers to grasp their investment situation more timely, accurately and completely, and
How to register for API?

The reporter noticed that the “Fund Account” APP has been uploaded to the application stores of Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo, etc., but the APP is still in the public test phase, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, and investors can contact the fund management company that holds their fund to obtain it.

A large public fund client service staff in Shanghai provided the reporter with a six-digit invitation code and told the reporter, “The APP is in the trial operation stage, China Clearing provides each fund management company with a certain number of invitation codes, which investors can obtain by calling us, and we will provide them.
After the trial ends, users can register without the invitation code.

The reporter registered the account and completed the query by downloading and using the relevant documents of "Fund E Account" as disclosed on the website of the CSRC, and the whole process only took a few minutes, and was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real name authentication, fund account binding, and public fund query.

After the real name authentication step, click the "Assets" fund binding button, all the fund products purchased by the reporter through the fund sales platform will be displayed in the binding option list (binding account), and after binding, the total assets of the fund invested can be directly seen and the query function can be used.
It is worth noting that the "fund E account" only provides query services to investors and cannot conduct redemption and purchase.
The data displayed by "Fund E Account" is generally three trading days before the date of the user's query (T day).

For example, if you open the "Fund E Account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to three trading days before that date, i.e., February 7.

The United States, Japan, and the Philippines have reached a consensus on defense against the CCP
Asia - On February 9, Philippine President Bongbong Marcos visited Japan and met with Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.

Both sides agreed to oppose the Chinese Communist Party’s infringement of the South China Sea and the East China Sea. The leaders of the Philippines and Japan issued a joint statement after the meeting, saying that they would conduct substantive defense exchanges through signing a trilateral defense agreement with the United States and oppose the Chinese Communist Party’s hegemonic policy.

Vice President of the Nationalist Party, Xia Lijian, conveyed the message of Soong to China: welcome the Green Party to visit the mainland under the 1992 Consensus

French unions again mobilize against government pension reform

On Saturday (February 11), the French trade unions launched a national mobilization against the government's draft retirement reform, calling on the people to take to the streets to express their opinions.
It is the fourth day of social protest against the government's draft pension reform.
The number of people who respond to the call for the rally may affect the next action plan of the trade union group.
It is the fourth time in a month that the eight major French trade unions have jointly launched a nationwide mobilization, and the first time that the protests have been scheduled for a Saturday.

Given that Saturday is a public holiday for most French people, who do not need to choose between participating in a demonstration and going on strike, the union hopes that today's rally will attract more people.

Unions for public transport, the metro and the SNCF railway company did not call for strikes today, and public transport should be able to operate normally, allowing people to travel to the rallies, while people in areas where schools are on winter holidays can also travel normally.
The unions hope to see more than a million people at the rally, while the police expect between 600,000 and 800,000 people nationwide, with between 90,000 and 120,000 in the Paris region.

Since the start of the protests against the government's pension reform plan, the number of people taking to the streets has gradually decreased, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure to delay the legal retirement age from 62 to 64.
The first strike on January 31 brought together between 1.27 million and 2.5 million people across the country.
The number of protesters on Tuesday (February 7) had dwindled to between 757,000 and two million people nationwide.
The pension reform is currently being discussed in the French National Assembly.
Opposition parties, particularly those on the left, have submitted numerous amendments, slowing down the process.
The debate between the two sides is also becoming more intense and sharp.

A member of the radical left-wing party France Insoumise shared a photo on social media of himself stepping on a balloon with the image of the Minister of Labour, prompting protests from the ruling party.
The National Assembly president ultimately declared the lawmaker ineligible to participate in parliamentary activities for 15 days as punishment for the behavior.

Despite the fact that this reform plan has triggered the largest social movement in France in more than 20 years, so far the government has made only minor adjustments to the draft, but has not made any major concessions.
The unions have already prepared to launch another action on Thursday, March 16, and they also plan to organize demonstrations on March 7, when the reform bill will be debated in the Senate.

East Germany's last communist leader dies
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "last night Hans Modrow left us, aged 95.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
"We have lost an important leader. "
Four days after the Berlin Wall, which had separated East Berlin from West Berlin for 28 years, was opened on November 13, 1989, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At the time, communist leaders were forced from power as protesters across East Germany demanded democracy and freedom.
Gorbachev had called for changes in Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe after taking power in the Soviet Union.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic (GDR).
The election result led to his resignation as chancellor.
Despite the reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to rebuild the secret police rather than abolishing it.
In 1993, Modrow was convicted of electoral fraud in the May 1989 municipal elections, but did not go to prison.
The U.S. Justice Department denied the charges were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German parliament and served as a member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modrow saw himself as a reformer who wanted to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want a return to the old East Germany, but said the achievements of the East should be acknowledged.
Modrow was born in 1928 in the then German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica in Poland) and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he was a fire brigade sergeant and, as the conflict drew to a close, he became a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi militia that called up men aged between 16 and 60 to fight in the final battles.
When he was 17, Modrow was captured by Soviet troops and taken as a prisoner of war to the Soviet Union, where he took courses in anti-fascism and became a firm communist.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found work as a mechanic, and continued his studies in social sciences and economics, earning a doctorate.

Modrow was a staff member of the Free German Youth movement, which was almost universal among East Germans, and rose through the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) to become chairman of the Dresden district party between 1973 and 1989.
He also served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, holding the highest state office.
Iran marks revolution anniversary with hacked presidential speech
Iran's official gathering to mark the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution was briefly interrupted by anti-government hackers on Saturday, as President Ebrahim Raisi addressed the crowd.
The president's televised speech was interrupted for about a minute on the internet by a group of anti-government hackers, who call themselves "Edalat Ali" or "Ali's Justice."
There was also a voice shouting "Death to the Islamic Republic."
Hackers interrupted state television coverage of Iran's anniversary of the revolution, Reuters reported today.

Iran's official commemoration of the 44th anniversary of the Islamic Revolution was met with the most daring challenge yet to the hard-line government of President Hassan Rouhani, as young protesters calling for his ouster took to the streets, but Rouhani still called on "deceived youth" to repent so they can be pardoned by the country's supreme leader.
Protests have continued across the country since the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in the custody of the country's morality police in September.
Iran's security forces have carried out a deadly crackdown on protests, one of the strongest challenges to the Islamic Republic since the 1979 revolution overthrew 2,500 years of monarchy.

As part of a general amnesty to mark the anniversary of the revolution, Iranian authorities on Friday released imprisoned dissident Farhad Meysami and Iranian-French scholar Fariba Adelkhah, who had been on hunger strike to protest their detention.
Earlier, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei issued a pardon that included some prisoners arrested in recent anti-government protests.
As of Friday, 528 protesters have been killed, including 71 minors, according to the human rights group HRANA.
Another 70 government security personnel were killed, the report said.
As many as 19,763 protesters have been arrested, according to the group.
Iranian leaders and state media have called for a vote at Saturday's gathering to show support for the government and against the protests.
On Friday night, the eve of the Iranian Revolution's anniversary, state media showed off fireworks as part of government-sponsored celebrations, with people chanting "Allahu Akbar!
(God is the greatest!)"
However, many of the chants at the rallies were also "Death to the dictator!"
" and the "Death of the Islamic Republic" in a video posted on social media.
On Saturday, state television broadcast live images from official gatherings across the country.
In Tehran, domestically produced anti-ballistic missiles, drones, submarine chasers and other military equipment were displayed as part of official celebrations.
President Raisi's speech was frequently interrupted by chants of "Death to America" - a signature slogan at state rallies.
The crowd also chanted "Death to Israel."
Adelkhah, who has been in prison since 2019, is one of seven French nationals held in Iran, a factor in the deterioration of relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months, Reuters said.
She was sentenced to five years in prison in 2020 on national security charges.
They later put her under house arrest, but she returned to prison in January.
Adelkhah denied the charges.
Messaimi was released a week after his supporters warned he was at risk of death due to his hunger strike.
He was arrested in 2018 for protesting against the obligatory veil.
The French foreign ministry on Friday called for Adelkhah's release and her "freedom to return to France if she so wishes."
"We call for her immediate release and for her to be allowed to return to France if she so wishes," the ministry said.
Did the balloon incident make the US look better?
Tougher restrictions on tech exports to China
According to a report by the Wall Street Journal today, the balloon incident has prompted the United States to further tighten its technology exports to China.

Current and former security officials said that the balloon incident highlighted the national security threat posed by China and would win more political support for strengthening US technology protection.
The U.S. said the balloon carried antennas and sensors for intelligence gathering and communication.
According to Martijn Rasser, a former senior official of the US Central Intelligence Agency and now serving at the Washington think tank New American Security Center.
"This is without doubt fuel for the hardliners against China."

"We will also consider taking broader actions to expose and respond to China's larger surveillance activities that pose a threat to our national security and that of our allies and partners," White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre told reporters on Thursday.
"U.S. officials say they have briefed governments in more than 30 countries about the balloon incident, underscoring the importance of international coordination in responding to the Chinese threat.

Apart from the Biden administration's actions, the new U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on the Strategic Competition Between the United States and the Chinese Communist Party could also put pressure on the U.S. to take more stringent measures to slow down China's development, said Emily Benson, a senior research fellow at the Center for Strategic and International Studies.
She said that lawmakers will feel increasing pressure to take a tougher stance, which could force the White House to adopt a more aggressive policy.
The Wall Street Journal said that many people advocating stricter export controls are also pushing to expand the scope of controls to include industries such as artificial intelligence.
The U.S. government has also been developing a foreign investment review program to examine whether U.S. investments abroad pose potential national security threats from China.
Analysts said the White House may face calls to move faster on the plan.
Earthquake relief in Turkey continues day and night
Since the powerful earthquake hit Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have worked tirelessly day and night to pull survivors from the rubble of thousands of buildings.
In the cold, they often call for silence, as they strain to hear any sign of life from the rubble.
Two more women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake days after they survived, Reuters reported today.
But the death toll from the quake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey's death toll is 20,665, while Syria's is more than 3,500.

The 7.8-magnitude quake that struck on Monday, which has been followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and coming close to the 31,000 deaths caused by the 2003 quake in neighboring Iran.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000.
Two women were rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Turkey 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake to hit the region in two decades, Turkish authorities said on Saturday.
Another injured man, 55-year-old Masallah Cicek, was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, the largest city in southeastern Turkey.
In the cold, rescuers often call for silence as they strain to hear any sign of life amid the rubble of crumbling concrete.
In Turkey's Samandag district, rescuers crouched under concrete slabs, whispering "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He opened his eyes and Yagiz Ulas, wrapped in a blanket, was carried to the field hospital.
Video images showed that the rescuers also took away his mother, who was dizzy and pale-faced but conscious on a stretcher.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people had been pulled from the rubble in the past 24 hours, with 31,000 rescuers deployed to the disaster zone.
He said that around 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals and 1.05 million were homeless after the earthquake, crammed into temporary shelters.
The response of the two leaders to the disaster has been questioned by the population, who lack food in the cold winter conditions.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife, Asma, visited a hospital in Aleppo, the first time he has reportedly been to a disaster zone since the earthquake, Syrian state media said.
Earlier, the World Food Program said it was running out of stocks in northwestern Syria, which is controlled by rebels, because the war made the relief work complicated.
On Friday, Erdogan visited Adiyaman province in Turkey, where he admitted that the government's response had not been as fast as it should have been.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a May 14 vote that could be delayed by the disaster.
Anger over the delay in providing aid and launching rescue efforts could affect the election, Reuters said.
Even before the quake, the vote was seen as Erdogan's most serious challenge in two decades in power.
Erdogan called for unity and denounced what he called "negative moves for political interests."
The leader of Turkey's main opposition party, Kemal Kilicdaroglu, criticized the government's response.
"The earthquake was big, but what is more serious than the earthquake is the lack of coordination, the lack of planning and the incompetence," the criticism said.
"We are not in a state of emergency," he said.

VNA Hanoi -- VNA Special Envoy and Correspondent reported that during his visit to Brunei Darussalam, on the morning of February 11, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD, abbreviated as "Brunei University").
UBD is the largest higher education and scientific research center in Brunei, and ranks third in the university rankings in the region.
UBD is one of the symbols of Vietnam's and Brunei's cooperation in education and training.
UBD and Vietnam's FPT University established a cooperative relationship in July 2013, mainly in the field of English training.
In addition to English, French, German, Japanese and Korean as foreign languages, UBD also includes Vietnamese in its teaching curriculum.
During the visit to UBD, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife exchanged with students in the Vietnamese class.
Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh is happy that more foreigners like to learn Vietnamese, which will contribute to the promotion of Vietnamese culture and local customs to the world.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh expressed his belief and hope that the Vietnamese language teaching team of the University of Brunei Darussalam would become stronger; the students of the Vietnamese language class would become more interested in Vietnamese, strive to learn, and be able to use fluent Vietnamese early, and become the messenger of the friendly cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei.

During the visit, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also communicated with Vietnamese students studying English at the FPT-UBD Global Center in Da Nang via video to understand their learning situation, especially during the pandemic.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh believes that the cooperation between Vietnam's FPT University and the University of Brunei Darussalam, especially the FPT-UBD Global Centre, is a vivid symbol of Vietnam's educational cooperation with Brunei.

At the same time, he hoped that the students of the center would make greater progress in their studies and make positive contributions to the friendly cooperative relations between Vietnam and the two countries.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the achievements of the two countries in educational cooperation, including the cooperation between FPT University and UBD University, and the inclusion of Vietnamese language in the curriculum of UBD University.
Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh hoped that the University of Malaya would continue to pay attention to ensuring the quality of Vietnamese teaching and further expand the scale of Vietnamese classes.

The Prime Minister of Vietnam, Pham Minh Chinh, also highly appreciated the positive results of the cooperation between the two countries based on the memorandum of understanding on education cooperation signed in April 2014; he recommended that Brunei continue to provide more scholarships and effectively carry out various short-term exchange training programs, such as the Global Discovery Programme and the Discovery Year.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh highly appreciated the establishment of the University of Malaya's first branch in Vietnam in Southeast Asia; believed that the university's development scale in the region and the world would become increasingly strong; and further expanded cooperation with Vietnamese universities.
On this occasion, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife planted a commemorative tree and left a message in the commemorative book at the campus of the University of Malaya.

Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh wished that the University of Malaya would continue to develop and contribute more power to the education industry of Malaya, and cooperate more deeply and widely with Vietnamese educational and training institutions.

What was the "object" that was shot down over Alaska?
It is a mystery, and many people are guessing
The US military again used the most advanced stealth fighter F-22 on Friday afternoon (February 10) to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the US Alaska skies.
The object was shot down 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
It is the second time in less than a week that the US military has shot down an aerial object.
Last Saturday, a Chinese spy balloon drifted over the US for days before it was shot down off the coast of South Carolina.

The Pentagon said the second object shot down entered US airspace on Thursday night, was tracked by the US military as it moved over northeastern Alaska at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, and much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon also said there was no indication that the object was maneuverable.

The object, which was flying at high altitude, was "a reasonable threat to civil aviation," said John Kirby, the strategic communications coordinator for the National Security Council at the White House, on Friday.
Cobey said the object did not have a "payload" suspended from it, as was the case with the Chinese spy balloon that was discovered over the United States.
"We refer to it as a 'thing' because that's the best description we have at this point," Kobie said.
President Biden took the advice of the Pentagon before ordering the object to be shot down, and he made the decision "very carefully," Kobie added.
The U.S. official description of the object can be roughly summarized as: the size of a small car, no control stick, no suspension, and a flight altitude of about 10,000 meters.
But that information does not answer basic questions about what the object is, who owns it, and what it is doing.
Many online analyses and speculations suggest that it could be another Chinese balloon.
It may be from China, like the spy balloon that invaded US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, performing some kind of mission.
Some have linked the Alaska "object" to "unidentified flying objects" (UFOs).
"I really hope this 'unidentified flying object' is a spy balloon and not a legitimate UFO," former U.S. Congressman Peter Meijer tweeted on Friday, according to Newsweek.
"The irony of lumping alien spacecraft in with weather balloons is surprising, but not worth triggering an interstellar conflict," Meijer said.
Meijer tweeted shortly after Kobe confirmed the object in Alaska had been shot down.
Newsweek said that Meijer is not the only one who suspects the object was a UFO.

Tennessee Republican Rep. Tim Burchett criticized the government's practice of withholding intelligence last month and demanded the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) release a report on the "unidentified flying object."

I don't recommend reading it.
I read it a long time ago, and I just happened to see it in my memory and write down my feelings.
This book is not a collection of short stories, but rather a collection of fragments of life about love.
The tone of the book is extremely plain, like plain water, and the words and phrases are extremely simple, and the plot is as quiet and plain as the streets in the afternoon of summer.
Each short story is a snapshot of a small part of ordinary life, with no beginning and no end.
Finally, they are collected together under the title of "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love".

I think this collection of short stories, and its title, is a kind of performance art. The author wants to express that love is not only the ups and downs of the stage, the myths of the sea and the rocks, or the sticky and glue-like relationship between you and me. Love is not only what is above, and should not be represented by what is above. Love is also the plain and boring life, the dull and tasteless day after
When you read this book, you may recall the quarrels of your husband and wife, the tasteless marriage of people you know, and the unsatisfactory love.

This is the reason why I do not recommend reading this book. From the aesthetic point of view, the writing and plot of this book are tasteless, unless your life is turbulent or sweet like living in a candy castle, otherwise you will feel strange and boring when reading.

And in terms of depth of thought, the everyday scenarios are not particularly illuminating or expansive (unlike Marquez’s Love in the Time of Cholera), and the brief snippets do not address any issues, such as what kind of mistakes lead to failed relationships.
What are the reasons for the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
So I would not recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not is not that significant.
The author's ideas are expressed more through techniques and style than through the story, which is also the reason why the reading experience of this book is not good.
It is suitable for a quick read, not for a detailed reading.
The book is well-structured, but not very full.
It explains what and why of many sales theories, but is weak in how to do it, only pointing out the direction but not giving specific practices.
Also, the book feels like it was put together.
For example, there are both domestic and foreign; both famous entrepreneurs or salesmen and unknown people.
It is not clear whether these stories are compiled for the sake of examples, and if the author has experienced some of these stories, it would be more convincing.
The customer is referred to as a client or customer.
The title is still customer, but in the main text, it has become customer.
The e-book also had problems with misspellings, missing punctuation, and incorrect numbering.
In summary, this book is a good choice as an introduction to the theory, but it is not suitable for people who have already engaged in sales work and want to improve their sales level.
A Quick Guide to Internet Finance

This book is shallow, and can be said to be only an introduction, which can help you quickly understand the overall situation of Internet finance, but to understand it in depth, you still need to follow the map and dig it yourself.

And the book was written earlier, so the content of later Alipay WeChat subsidy war to cultivate user habits has not been mentioned, and now the proportion of third-party payment is probably not as small as the book said.
Nowadays, many people take their mobile phones with them when they go out to eat, and merchants have also abandoned UnionPay because of the high bank flow.

However, I am very grateful to the author for writing this introduction book, which shows that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience and is very familiar with the financial development history at home and abroad, so it can write such popular and easy-to-understand content.
It is easy to write high and wide, but it is difficult to write in plain language.
I appreciate you, and I want you to know that!
The first factor that determines a person’s job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether they are given enough attention and recognition in their work.
According to Maslow’s Hierarchy, after the basic needs of human survival are met, the most urgent need is the psychological need of being understood, recognized and appreciated.
Indeed, for the Chinese people, most of them are “hard to say ‘I love you’”, even if they have love, gratitude and praise, they will keep it in their hearts and not say it out loud.
In this book, the author explains five languages of appreciation: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, physical touch, and receiving gifts.

I think the important thing is not to know what the five languages of appreciation are, but to be able to use them from the bottom of your heart to appreciate and be grateful to the people around you, whether they are family, friends or colleagues.
In fact, the more intimate the person, the more they need praise and gratitude, and this is how we can make our lives more beautiful.
Learning to praise can also help companies retain talent to a certain extent and reduce the rate of resignation.
Thank you to the translator for bringing us the wonderful foreign thoughts and the world.

Due to the differences in the cultural background between the East and the West, there will be some differences between the languages, and if you have the opportunity to read the original version, I believe you will gain more.
Thank you again to the author and translator, as well as the editors, for their hard work!

The worst shopping experience ever

On the night of September 23, my wife dropped her phone, so I immediately ordered an 8p from Amazon Malaysia, which was in stock but not self-owned and did not increase the price (secretly happy), because it was not self-owned, the delivery was slow, and the system showed that the estimated delivery date was September 27.

My wife was so upset that she didn't have a phone, so she called me at 6:30 in the morning to see if there was anything we could do. Later, I checked JD.com and saw that there was a 256G version in stock that could be delivered the same day, so I immediately ordered another one.
I thought I would cancel the Amazon order right away.

Because the order was placed in the middle of the night, it was impossible for the courier to come to pick up the package in the morning, so I called customer service at around 7:30 to cancel the order, and the customer service representative replied that the order had already been canceled and that I should wait for the notification message.

Okay, I will wait patiently, and when I checked my phone in the afternoon, I found that the order was still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contacted customer service to ask them to cancel the order as soon as possible, and the customer service replied that it was already OK.

At 3 pm, I checked my phone and found that the order was still there. I could not do anything but contact the customer service again to clarify that I had called three times, and asked them to cancel the order and notify the seller that the delivery must not be made!

The customer service representative contacted the seller on my request, and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system, and that I should wait until the seller was familiar with the system before cancelling the order.
But I was told that the seller already knew about it and would definitely not send the package, so please don't worry.
When I checked the order on Monday, it showed that it had been shipped, and I was speechless.
Because I couldn't contact the seller directly, I had to call the customer service again.
The handling after that was just ridiculous, basically I would say one thing and the customer service would then do something else.
The order is still in the status of refusing to accept the delivery, and is being prepared to be sent again!
Does Amazon not follow up?
The seller's company has received the money anyway, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up.
In conclusion, we will never pay for large items in advance in the future, this is too troublesome.
